data.title: Lt Col Henry Edward Stopford
data.text:
Notes for Lt Col Henry Edward Stopford

His birth index:

Name: Mother's Maiden Surname:

STOPFORD, HENRY EDWARD WILBRAHAM

GRO Reference: 1842 M Quarter in THE CHELTENHAM UNION Volume 11 Page 205

___________________

His baptism from an image of the Register, thanks Ancestry, transcript by me:

“ Fol.374

“ Baptisms Solemnized

“In the Parish of St George, Hanover Square in the County of Middlesex, in the Year 1842 January

“. . . .

“When baptized: 26

“No: 47

“Child’s Forename: Henry Edward

“Parents’ Forenames: Edward & Julia Maria

“Parents’ Surname: Stopford

“Abode: Mount St

“When born: 3 Novr. 1841

“Professiong: Captn. R.N.

“Celebrant: P Scholfield

__________________

In 1891 they were at Manor Houses, Upper Woodside, Lymington, Hampshire:

First name(s) Last name Relationship Marital status Sex Age Birth year Occupation Birth place

Henry E Stopford Head M M 49 1842 Lt colonel retired list Cheltenham, Gloucestershire

Constance M Stopford Wife M F 34 1857 - Southampton, Hampshire

Ellen Hampton Serv S F 27 1864 Parlourmaid Hampshire

Elizabeth Bran Serv S F 23 1868 Cook Lymington, Hampshire

Ralph Bran Serv S M 17 1874 Page Lymington, Hampshire

Agnes Stone Serv - F 13 1878 Under housemaid Pennington, Hampshire

Ref:

Archive reference RG12

Piece number 898

Folio 104

Page 12

Combined: 1891 ref: RG12, piece 898, folio 104, p. 12

_______________

No children found in a search for Stopford births with a mother’s maiden name of Hammersley

_______________

BP reported: “Henry Edward; b 13 Nov 1841; Lt-Col 36th Regt; m 25 Oct 1882 Constance Maria (d Jan 1930), dau of Montolieu Hammersley, and dsp 26 Dec 1895”

_______________

His death index:

Name: Age at Death (in years):

STOPFORD, HENRY EDWARD 54

GRO Reference: 1895 D Quarter in DAVENTRY Volume 03B Page 68

_______________

Will notes for Lt Col Henry Edward Stopford

His probate index:

1896

STOPFORD Henry Edward of Falconer’s Hill Daventry Northamptonshire colonel in Her Majesty’s army died 26 December 1895- Probate Northampton 28 May to George Waller Stopford esquire and Robert Wilbraham Stopford captain in Her Majesty’s royal navy Effects Â£9701 4s.

Will ordered.

_____________________

In his will dated 19th of November 1892 he appointed the two executors above and listed additionally:

1. His cousin Philip James Stopford, Lt RN,

2. His sister Edith Louisa Kennedy,

3. His niece Alice Emily Kennedy,

But no mention of his wife Constance.

_____________________

Notes for Henry Edward & Constance Maria (Family)
